Course_Name: [SoSe 2024] Nanomaterials: Synthesis, Size-Dependent Properties and Applications / Nanomaterialien: Synthese, Eigenschaften, Anwendungen

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students. I apologize for the confusion. It seems the online exam date was previously discussed that it would be on the week of 15 - 19 July. To give you more time to prepare, the exam will open on Monday 15.07 in the morning, and you will have one opportunity to take it, until closing on Friday Afternoon that week. Regarding the video presentations, please upload your work to the TUBcloud folder by 15 July. Also please submit the slides on the ISIS submission tool, for grading For any questions,  I remain at your disposal.  Sincerely,  Dorian

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students,  Thank you for your participation in the course this year. I hope you have had a rewarding learning experience. Please take a few minutes to complete the course evaluation survey at the following link https://befragung.tu-berlin.de/evasys/online.php?pswd=YSTZ2 Regarding the student presentations, along with the exam, these will be due on the week of 8-12 July. I am still waiting from the ISIS team to see whether video presentations can be uploaded by students to ISIS. If not, we will do this in a series of Zoom meetings in the mornings of this week, so please have your presentations ready by this time. I look forward to seeing you all soon. Best regards, Dorian

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students,  A self-revision quiz is now available for you to complete here on the ISIS page. It relates to the first 5 modules of the course, that we looked at together in the tutorial sessions. Please contact me if you have any questions.  Best wishes  Dorian

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Spectroscopy and electronic properties of nanomaterials

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dear students, This is just a reminder that tomorrow's session will be held by Dr. Tristan Petit, who will take you on a voyage through the optical / electronic properties of nanomaterials and the use of spectroscopic characterisation towards understanding the nature of materials at the nanoscale kindest regards, Dorian

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, Please take the time this week to explore the fascinating world of carbon nanomaterials. Do some of your own research and peruse the resources available through the ISIS page to discover new things about the processing, performance and applications of various carbon materials formed at the nanoscale. This is a fascinating nexus of chemistry, physics and technology. I look forward to examining this topic further during our discussion session on Thursday Kindest regards, Dorian

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, We have our 4th session this Thursday. In this session we will discuss top-down fabrication, nanostructured bulk materials, and mechanical and magnetic properties of nanomaterials. Please come prepared with some discussion points! Have a look at the ISIS content and familiarize youselves with methods for the production of nanomaterials through top-down methods and identify several nanocrystalline materials used in the real world, and their properties. Please have a look at the tutorial questions that are available in the ISIS page.  Kindest regards,  Dorian

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest Students, We meet again at the scheduled time of 8:30 on Thursday for another discussion session. This time we will focus on bottom up synthesis of nanomaterials and the mechanical interactions between nanoparticles.  As discussed previously, please have a look at the questions and and the self-access content before attending this session. Find some interesting nanomaterial examples from the real-world usage scenarios and come prepared with some interesting discussion points.   I look forward to seeing you all there Kindest regards, Dorian Tutorial questions

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, We will have our session tomorrow at 10, as mentioned, due to the public holiday on Thursday. On another note, the exam for this module is available for registration now on Moses, please don't forget to enrol.  Cheers  Dorian

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Next week session will be on Wednesday 8 May 10:00

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, As next week there is another public holiday on Thursday, we will have our tutorial session on Wednesday 8 May at 10:00, my apologies for the confusion. The next session will be on the topic of surfaces, phases and nucleation. Please have a look at the self access content for session II (in sections IIa and IIb of the ISIS topics) and consider the following tutorial questions Looking forward to seeing you all there! Best wishes Dorian

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, We will postpone this week's session to next week, as many people are using the May day holiday to make an extra-long weekend! We will meet on 09.05.2024 to further discuss the content of surfaces and bulk, nucleation and phase stability. Tutorial questions for this session will be posted soon. For any questions, please feel free to post in the discussion forum or contact me via email. Best wishes, Dorian Hanaor

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dear students, We will meet tomorrow morning to discuss the course and its contents. In this introductory session we will examine the definition of nanomaterials - what counts as a nanomaterial?  Please read the ISIS content and the self-access lecture slides / recordings to familiarise yourselves with this topic  Please see the tutorial questions for our first session. Before attending tomorrow's session, please try to think of some examples of products and companies that use nanomaterials. We will discuss this in the group. I look forward to meeting you all tomorrow. Please note-attendance of this session is mandatory. Thanks for your understanding.  Best regards Dorian  https://isis.tu-berlin.de/pluginfile.php/3170836/mod_forum/post/1062462/Nanomaterials%20Tutorial%20Session%201.pdf

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: Dearest students, It brings me great pleasure to welcome you warmly to the course Nanomaterials for summer semester 2024. We will start our face-to-face sessions next week, on 25.04.2024 at 8:30 in BA3, room 316. These sessions are intended for an interdisciplinary exchange and a tutorial examination of the course content. The course content is available through ISIS. You should look through the lecture slides and the recorded video lectures from previous years to acquaint yourselves with the themes we are examining week by week. The second half of this course will be conducted with Dr. Tristan Petit, on the topic of spectroscopic characterisation of nanomaterials - one of the most important aspects of this branch of materials science.  This will be my last semester teaching here at TU Berlin, due to the WZG I look forward to meeting you all next week. Best regards, Dorian

Forums.Forum_name: Course Announcements and Questions- Nachrichten Forum

Messages.Author: Hui En Faith Tng
Messages.Content: Hi there, May I know if this class would be held in English, when would be the regular class dates, and if there is an option to attend online / will the lectures be recorded? Thank you!  Kind regards, Faith

Messages.Author: Dorian Amir Henry Hanaor
Messages.Content: The class will be in English. We will have tutorial sessions on Thursday. The lectures and the learning materials will be self-access online. The times and dates for our tutorial sessions will be announced soon.  Best regards, Dorian
